scenario: Do you challenge the status quo with your solution?
description: How? Is that good or bad?

scenario: Who benefits from your solution?
Where in the world is your solution a problem?
Does our society benefit from your solution?
Does your solution challenge or reproduce existing inequities?
How is power showing up within/through your solution?
Does your solution help to build a positive future?
description: If yes, how? If not, why not?

scenario: What is the worst that could happen with your solution?
Does your solution make people change their habits?
description: How? Is it good or bad?

scenario: When is your solution unacceptable?
How does your solution promote collaboration and connection?
What arguments would strong opponents of your solution bring forward?
description: What would they say and why?

scenario: Is there anything in your solution that makes you feel uncomfortable?
Is your solution dependent on someone's weaknesses?
Are there people who are excluded from your solution?
Who will your solution harm?
Who is most directly affected by your solution?
Are marginalized perspectives present in your solution?
description: What perspectives and how are they present?

scenario: What social identities are represented by your solution?
description: What identities and how are they represented?

scenario: In 10 years â€” how has your solution aged?
description: Describe how your solution is perceived in the future.

scenario: What small change could ethically improve your solution?
description: Describe the change and its impact.

scenario: What ethical principles does your product follow?
Does the solution represent your values?
Is it easy to understand the deeper mechanisms in your solution?
description: Why / why not? Is it a problem?

scenario: What are the weaknesses of your solution?
What other solutions were explored and why were they rejected?
What unspoken norms and beliefs are influencing your solution?
